job_title: Business Lecturer in Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui
pros: Flexible, Autonomy, Family friendly conditions and environment
cons: A lot of bureaucracy and old systems of doing stuff

job_title: Transition Coordinator in Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui
pros: Great induction Supportive colleagues Positive team atmosphere
cons: Still learning them so can’t comment

pros: Great place to work, friendly team, great perks
cons: No flexible working arrangement at the time

pros: Great autonomy plan your days PD Leave
cons: Lack of input for curriculum changes, no future chances for research

pros: Nice People, very rewarding to teach students.
cons: Poor company structure with very little support for career development. Just care about the money to the bottom line, not the careers of the lecturers or students.

job_title: Team Leader in Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui
pros: The individual team determines your experience. Can be excellent.
cons:
5 CEs in 3 years.
Restructuring.
Management can be unruly, strong cronyism

review_title: Not a bad place for career starters
pros: Flexible working hours and amiable staff
cons: Salary not at par with other ITPs

review_title: Great for part-time lecturing - up to 2007 (system forces 2009 as earliest year)
job_title: Architecte DPLG/Directeur De Projet in Masterton, Wellington
pros:
At Masterton campus, good management, great student population, use of networked learning channel (was Blackboard, apparently now Moodle),
New buildings for specialized courses.  Nursing programme very solidly established
cons: Shrinking rolls means staff having to take on cross-faculty courses occasionally,  low academic students don't always attend (but that leaves you with the dedicated learners).

pros: Very supportive colleagues and some flexibility with working arrangements
cons: Political and personal agendas are very high under top management team, no real concern for students or staff. Huge workloads that affect the students.
